inventory.commentary: Includes VPC remain_firm, remain_down Includes duplicate mappings of WordNet sense 3.

sense.name: remain in a certain state
sense.commentary: Note: This sense includes abstract uses. Syntax Includes: NP1 REMAIN ADJ/ADVP[manner] Includes: REMAIN FIRM, REMAIN DOWN
sense.examples: The President is expected to remain firm on his veto of the bill. In this game you must remain down to the count of ten.

sense.name: be left; stay behind; continue in a place, position, or situation
sense.commentary: Note: This sense includes concrete uses. Syntax Is: NP1[topic] REMAIN[stative] SCOMP
sense.examples: The fog and rain remained with us for a week. She remained with the child until he fell asleep. Although I washed the walls, a faint smell of cigarette smoke remains. What remains of the ancient city are just foundations of houses. He remains the only President whose administration was not involved in a war. If you subtract ten from twelve, two remain.

sense.name: be left to do
sense.examples: It remains to be seen whether China will cooperate. Much remains to be done before the deadline. Three cars remain to be fixed.
